greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest semiprime such that n primes will follow until the next semiprime.
comment: Is this sequence infinite? - _David A. Corneth_, Aug 17 2018
mathematica: om = Array[PrimeOmega, 1100000]; sp = Flatten@ Position[om, 2]; Table[ sp[[ SelectFirst[ Range[Length[sp] - 1], Count[Take[om, {sp[[#]], sp[[# + 1]]}], x_ /; x == 1] == j &, 0]]], {j, 0, 10}] (* _Giovanni Resta_, Aug 16 2018 *)
xref: Cf. A214520 (primes that are the only prime between consecutive semiprimes).
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 08 2003
